column2: This character has read a sutra, which has created a sense of ease and rejuvenation in thier kingship.
This character has read a sutra, which has created a clearer sense of understanding of dharma and thier kingship.
This character has read a sutra, which has espouses their kingship and thier role as earthly judges of Karma and Dharma.
This character has read a sutra for which life is of particular importance and thus they cultivate a garden in accordance to Dharma.
This character has failed their vow of asceticism.
This character is building a magnificent Stupa in the name of the Buddha.
This character has donated alms to the local temple and has made wonders for their bhikku.
This ruler has ordered the consecration of a great temple to MacArthur, the greatest warrior of Providence.
This ruler has ordered the consecration of a great temple to Roosevelt, the world-surfer.
This ruler has ordered the consecration of a great temple to Perry, the deal-maker.
This ruler has ordered the consecration of a great temple to Latmikaik, the mother of the sea.
This character has recieved good omens from their omikuji.
This character has recieved bad omens from their omikuji.
